text: feels weird when childhood memorabilia gets swapped out for modern stuff – our fave bookstore turned into some gadget shop recently; book smell > new tech smell any day! 😔
last time i checked out where they used to do storytime in our local library? now all beanbags n’ tablets... miss those raggedy books and imagination vibes 😔
starting a blog has been my low-budget fun fix lately!
cooking at home turned into fun hobby & saves ££!
rent struggles are no joke 😫
cutting down eating out big time - home cooking's basically turning into an accidental hobby now 🍲😂! anyone else getting their chef on more these days?
always stumble into cozy coffee corners - best unplanned detours tbh
hidden gem alert - old bookshops down crannies are like time portals; best surprise on a glum day! 😌📚
love finding cozy nooks in city bookshops!
been loving those tiny hidden cafes where you can just sink into an armchair & read undisturbed - pure gold!
lol feels ya! but there's still def spots out here untouched by selfie sticks - found an old bookshop corner where time slips away... pure magic ✨ just gotta look harder 😉
pre-dawn light hitting cobblestones = pure calm 🤎
quirky street poets by markets - surprisingly insightful stuff every time
those unexpected book exchanges popping up in phone boxes are everything - total treasure troves for a lit geek like me 📚😌
Bargain hunting at used book sales has become my superpower!

got into collecting vinyl records & i'm learning all about turntables - feels super retro but also kinda cool flipping through actual albums instead just streaming 🎶 brings out a whole new appreciation for music!
haven’t hit that "i'm fully adulting" stage yet but starting to save money despite low income definitely feels like leveling up in life 🎮 kinda proud ngl!
thought i'd be rich & famous by now tbh... turned out different but not too shabby when you love books lol
dreamt of big city lights as a kid; real treasure now’s quiet moments with loved ones & books that teleport you worlds away – didn’t plan for happiness in simplicity but here we are 😌
dreamt big too – shelves over stock portfolios here lol
library visits > netflix subscriptions lately... free books & chill beats streaming subs any day! 😌📚✨
streamed gigs can't match the energy of live ones tho 😔
cutting corners but never skimp at on espresso - priorities!
part-time gig but it’s all grind & zero trips

kinda get why you'd stick to what's predictable but sometimes i'm over here thinking whether these ramen nights are worth chasing lit degrees 🤔 love books more than anything though so guess we all just tryna find balance where we can!
books are life but don't exactly bring home big bucks 😂📚
library book sales - hidden gems everywhere!
urban exploring’s cool but it can get repetitive fast - ever tried diving into second-hand bookshops? huge worlds for tiny prices plus you meet real characters + u learn tons offbeat stuff 😄📚
but eating out cheap can be a dream too!
cheap days out rule but trust me rainy weather sucks big time
summer gigs are great until they ain't there anymore
feels like i'm always playing tetris with bank balance but meal prepping instead of eating out saves serious cash even though it’s kinda boring 😂 gotta get creative sometimes!
strict meal planning & pre-loved finds are clutch too
all about those simple joys, can’t put a price on them

feels like no matter how much your paycheck grows its always one step behind ‘lifestuff’ costs 😖 once i'm done studying & actually get into full gear work mode hope it’ll even out somehow... gotta keep those dream vacays in sight right? lol
peers living large makes wallet cry harder 😅
dreams don't always line up but sometimes reality surprises you

drowning in books & caffeine here wondering if all these late-night essay marathons will pay off 😅 dream job’s definitely more chill than academic pressure-cooker vibes rn - got fingers crossed i don’t end up questioning every life choice down the road! 🤞📚
loved studying lit but kinda low-key hustle RN
low pay but love being surrounded by books all day

kinda fell into book-lovin' as more than just a hobby - honestly, wouldn't trade it for anything else even though some might think its vintage vibes don’t pay much! feels right where numbers never did 😌📚
so everyone thinks working in bookstores means you spend all day reading - not even close! it’s more like playing tetris on shelves with books lol

lol tell me about it! ever since working surrounded by books i catch myself organizing literally everything by genre 😂 even groceries get divided into 'fantasy fruits' or 'mystery meats'. friends think i've lost it 😆

literature always felt like a universal calling beyond any 'supposed to'. just followed where the stories led me – now surrounded by them every day and wouldn’t have it any other way! kinda cool how some paths aren't about breaking or sticking to norms but pure love for the craft y'know?
took charge of renovations at home once - people were surprised cause it's seen as more of a guy thing usually... felt kinda badass 😎💪
gender norms feel pretty archaic especially post-secondary education influence
books were always more appealing than sports balls growing up - bucks tradition right there haha - never cared much for "girly" or "manly", just did what i loved 📚💪🏻
loved lit classes more than sports day tbh
they always think i’m just there for light duties...nope!
funny how ppl assume i can't handle tech stuff at work cuz i'm always around books! like hello - can def troubleshoot an e-reader better than most 😂 gotta love breaking those stereotypes!
people here start side-eyeing your bookshelf instead asking if you'll trade novels out for baby books soon 😬 #pressure

seen loads of friends mixing it up too! some folks are all about side hustles while their partners grind at more traditional gigs - pretty cool that there’s less pressure now for just one way to do things 😊
still lots of old-school pressure around 😬 feels slow-changing but getting there
kinda balancing stuff over here - kept up reading & internet lurking 😂 makes for some chill nights in when not hanging out with the other half! who knew you could juggle books n love life at once?
defo found i read wayy more now

def feel you gotta strike a balance! for me it’s been like mingling hobbies - got my so into some fantasy novels 📚and they introduced me to cooking fancy dishes at home 😋 keeps both worlds spinnin’ without ditchin’ old favs ya know?
got nada here...couldn't even guess my fav ice cream flavor 😑
shouldn't wait for special days tbh
kinda overrated how we hype up these grand gestures... sometimes just getting through daily stuff together without drama speaks volumes more imo 🤷‍♀️
honestly feels like random relationship luck than any real pattern
ever think maybe we're all just tryna make sense of chaos? life throws curveballs making 'relationship timelines' kinda moot tbh
long-term commitment = work + evolution, no clockwork milestones
every couple’s journey's different - can't generalize imo 🤷‍♀️
kinda crazy balancing low-key weekend plans with dreams of traveling more 🌍 relationships definitely make you re-evaluate your bucket list priorities rn lol
love means never having to say "can we afford splitting an uber?" so yeah partnership kinda rewrites your budget lol
tried gaming together... just ended up rage quitting 😂
tv tastes clashed at first but now we're tv show trivia pros lol
must be nice lol but got dragged into cycling with mine and honestly? never again. we're sticking to separate hobbies from now on 😂
usually not conscious of it but def shapes some faves
tbh sometimes you dont notice but those old city vibes can lurk in your stories like easter eggs - hidden but definitely there! 😆
can totally relate, but sometimes ya find new stories that shape you just as much!
i totally get both sides here but for me places i've been have def left their mark - like bookmarks in my story ya know? 😌📚
rustic charm turned me into a bookworm tbh
city vibes definitely shape you – got that love for gritty tales & endurance against daily chaos lol
every street had its own drama - like living in fiction!
